item.title: No title
item.description: Q&A: Can a wine be light-bodied and still have a "round mouthfeel"? http://ow.ly/3dkzDl

item.title: This Photographer Takes Fun Portraits of People After One, Two and Three Glasses of Wine
item.description:
This Photographer Takes Fun Portraits of People After One, Two and Three Glasses of Wine

What do you look like as you get increasingly buzzed from alcohol? Many of Marcos Alberti's friends now have photographic evidence. "There is a saying about wine that I really like and it's something like this: 'The first glass of wine is all about the food, the second glass is about love and the third glass is about mayhem,' " the Brazilian photographer tells AdFreak.

item.title: Lake County wineries: Meet the names on the bottles
item.description:
Lake County wineries: Meet the names on the bottles

Going wine tasting in rural Lake County is often a relaxed, rustic experience, with mom-and-pop wineries where Mom and Pop themselves pour the wines. Many properties offer boutique varietals, well worth discovering, along with welcoming, friendly moods.

item.title: Walla Walla - early, hot but good
item.description:
Walla Walla - early, hot but good

Like many wine regions around the world, Walla Walla in Washington state had its earliest harvest on record in 2015. Even so, producers throughout the Valley are happy with wine quality and most especially with the region's three most-planted varieties: Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Syrah.

item.title: Terroir is a Myth - Fermentation
item.description:
Terroir is a Myth - Fermentation

The idea that "Terroir" is the source of fine wine flavor is a myth. This is according to Professor Mark Matthews at the University of California, Davis in his new and controversial book: "Terroir and Other Myths of Winemaking." As the title of this new book implies, the myth of terroir is only part of Matthews' investigation.

item.title: Weekly New York Wine News - April 4, 2016
item.description:
Weekly New York Wine News - April 4, 2016

Co-owner and winemaker Paul Brock pruning vines in the estate vineyard at Silver Thread Vineyard. Edible East End - 3/22/2016 Long Island vintners line up their 2013 reds for market, and believe that the vintage will be a long-lived one.
